channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: India offers zero taxes through 2047 to lure global AI workloads
item.description: New Delhi's latest move comes as Amazon, Google, and Microsoft expand data center investments in India.

item.title: Qu'est-ce qui peut se former à -260°C dans le vide spatial ? Une molécule essentielle à la vie qui intrigue les scientifiques
item.description: On pensait que seules les molécules les plus simples pouvaient naître et exister dans l’espace interstellaire. Mais de nouvelles expériences montrent que des réactions chimiques plus complexes peuvent se produire dans les nuages de poussières interstellaires : les premières briques nécessaires à...

item.title: This tiny pocket-friendly e-reader is packed with frustration and potential
item.description: I've used and reviewed dozens of e-readers over the years, but the 5-inch Kobo Mini remains my favorite for one simple reason: It was small. While it lacked useful features like screen lighting and page turn buttons, its size made it an e-reader I actually wanted to carry every day. The $69 Xteink X4 e-reader […]

item.title: The Razer BlackShark V3 gaming headset might blend in with Razer's existing crowd, but the second you set it up, you just know it's something special
item.description: The Razer BlackShark V3 wireless headset is another solid addition to Razer's well-established headset arsenal, but it also packs enough in its sleek design to set it above the rest.

item.title: Bye-bye corporate conglomerates. Hello personal conglomerates.
item.description: Elon Musk's reported merging of SpaceX, xAI, and Tesla harkens back to the heyday of General Electric — or maybe the robber barons of the Gilded Age.

item.title: When Does ‘The Last of Us’ End? HBO Doesn’t Know
item.description: You (probably) won't see the last of 'The Last of Us' when it comes back next year, just Abby's side of the story.

item.title: Walmart is slashing prices on Super Bowl party essentials — here are 13 deals I'd buy on big-screen TVs, soundbars, air fryers, and more
item.description: Walmart is slashing prices on everything you need to host a Super Bowl party, including deals on big-screen TVs, soundbars, air fryers, and more.

item.title: How to watch the 2026 Grammy Awards with or without cable, including free options
item.description: Music’s biggest night will take place at the Crypto.com Arena in Los Angeles tonight, and cord-cutters can catch the action live. You are going to want to turn up the volume on your television sets. It’s time for the 68th Grammy Awards, which take place on Sunday, February 1.

item.title: I don’t hate the robot barista like I thought I would
item.description: In Seattle, the only thing we love more than coffee is our coffee shops. On a six-block walk I pass at least a half dozen, each with their own vibe: one focused on chai, another inside a yoga studio, a Starbucks that's surprisingly busy for late afternoon downtown. I passed them all up to get […]

item.title: Quordle hints and answers for Monday, February 2 (game #1470)
item.description: Looking for Quordle clues? We can help. Plus get the answers to Quordle today and past solutions.

item.title: NYT Connections hints and answers for Monday, February 2 (game #967)
item.description: Looking for NYT Connections answers and hints? Here's all you need to know to solve today's game, plus my commentary on the puzzles.

item.title: NYT Strands hints and answers for Monday, February 2 (game #701)
item.description: Looking for NYT Strands answers and hints? Here's all you need to know to solve today's game, including the spangram.

item.title: OnlyFans might sell majority stake to investment firm Architect Capital
item.description: Investment firm Architect Capital is apparently in talks to buy the adult content creator platform OnlyFans
